intro: Schlegelia brachyantha var. portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican schlegelia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are ovate with a smooth texture and often have a waxy appearance.
